PLC Controllers in Industry 4.0
Division of PLC Controllers
• Compact/Micro: All I/O and CPU in one housing; cost-effective for small machines.
• Modular/Rack: Separate CPU, I/O, high I/O count, hot-swap for large installations.
• Distributed I/O: Decentralized nodes near field devices; reduces wiring overhead.
Popular PLC Extension Modules
• Communication Modules: EtherNet/IP, Profinet, Modbus TCP for IIoT integration.
• Analog & Specialty I/O: 4–20 mA cards, thermocouple modules for measurement tasks.
• Motion & Safety I/O: Integrated drives, safety relays for emergency shutdown.
• Fieldbus Gateways: Profibus, DeviceNet, IO-Link for distributed control.
Leading PLC Manufacturers
• Siemens (S7-1500, S7-1200): Automotive, pharma, digital twin focus.
• Rockwell (ControlLogix, CompactLogix): Packaging, analytics, safety integration.
• Schneider (Modicon M580, M340): Energy, water, EcoStruxure platform.
• Mitsubishi (MELSEC iQ): Electronics, edge-AI integration.
• Omron (NJ/NX Series): Assembly, vision integration.
• Beckhoff (CX Series): PC-based control, EtherCAT motion.
Software for PLC Design & Visualization
• TIA Portal (Siemens): Unified programming, simulation.
• Studio 5000 (Rockwell): Ladder, FBD, ST, integrated analytics.
• EcoStruxure Machine Expert (Schneider): IEC 61131-3, simulation.
• Codesys: Multi-vendor IEC 61131-3, visualization.
• TwinCAT 3 (Beckhoff): Real-time control, Matlab/Simulink coupling.
PLC Programming Languages
• Ladder Diagram (LAD): Discrete logic, motor control.
• Function Block Diagram (FBD): PID loops, process control.
• Structured Text (ST): Complex algorithms, batch sequencing.
• Instruction List (IL): Low-level, legacy systems.
• Sequential Function Chart (SFC): Batch/state-machine processes.
• Python: Edge analytics, OPC UA data collection.
